definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Critics of transgenic foods say this is ridiculous.
sentences.chinese: 轉基因食品的批評者認爲這很可笑。

sentences.english: It is audacious, disruptive and preposterous on the face of it.
sentences.chinese: 表面看來，其膽大妄爲，且顛覆常理，又荒誕可笑。

sentences.english: And they're fighting over something so ridiculous
Also ridiculous is exasperating, Jiading really have a garden path.
sentences.chinese: 可氣又可笑的是，嘉定還真有一條梅園路。

sentences.english: It's grotesque to expect a person of her experience to work for such little money.
sentences.chinese: 想讓有她那樣經驗的人爲這點兒錢工作真是可笑。

sentences.english: The funny thing about marriage is that the newness soon wears off.
sentences.chinese: 婚姻的一個可笑之處是新鮮感馬上就沒有了。

sentences.english: They asked us to move back a few times but were very nice and sometimes funny about it.
sentences.chinese: 他們問我們搬回了幾次，但很不錯，有時甚至可笑的。

sentences.english: I am wiser than to believe what you call money talks.
sentences.chinese: 我不至於可笑到相信你所謂的金錢萬能的說法。

sentences.english: Looking back, I laugh at the harebrained folly of my scheme.
sentences.chinese: 回頭想起來，我對自己欠考慮的計劃荒唐事感到可笑。

sentences.english: I was made to look ridiculous because of Fowler, and I defended him.
sentences.chinese: 我被當成很好可笑，就因爲科拿，而我是保護他。

sentences.english: Blokes are champions of the ridiculous.
I make my pain a ear a urd, afraid that you should do so.
sentences.chinese: 我之所以把我的痛苦說得可笑，因爲我怕你會這樣做。

sentences.english: This was Politburo-style innovation and was laughable.
sentences.chinese: 這是類似政治局決策機構似的創新，非常可笑。

sentences.english: First, the mere idea of ambition in the factory was ludicrous.
sentences.chinese: 首先，在這樣的工廠裏提到遠大志向是可笑的。

sentences.english: HANTUCHOVA: Yeah, that's ridiculous, I think.
The book read like a black comic burlesque.
sentences.chinese: 這本書讀起來像部荒誕可笑的諷刺作品。

definition: comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
